segments.text: This is our rock-bottom price , Mr . Lee .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If that's the case . there's not much point in further discussion . We might as well call the whole deal off .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What I mean is that we'll never be able to come down to your price . The gap is too great .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think it unwise for either of us to be inflexible . How about meeting each other halfway ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Your unit price is 100 dollars higher than we want . Well , I suggest we meet each other halfway .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you mean a further reduction of 50 dollars in our price ? That's impossible !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The best we can do is another 30 dollars off . That's definitely the lowest we can go .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That still leaves a gap of 20 dollars . Let's meet each other half-away again and split the difference ; I think this is a price we can both be satisfied with .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK . We can meet halfway again .
segments.speaker: S1
